snippet: The health department said that it had commitments from about 150 establishments in the area, and that the program could eventually be extended into other boroughs.
abstract: New York City Health Dept says that it has commitments from about 150 grocers in the Bronx to encourage healthy eating habits by prominently featuring nutritious foods like fruits and vegetables near store entrances, while shifting less healthy snacks and drinks to the back; program, part of Bloomberg administration's fight against an obesity epidemic, could eventually be brought to other boroughs.
lead_paragraph: The health department said that it had commitments from about 150 establishments in the area, and that the program could eventually be extended into other boroughs.

headline.seo: City Works With Bronx Stores on Offering More Healthful Foods
headline.main: City Works With Bronx Stores on Offering More Healthful Foods
headline.print_headline: In Bronx, Prime Spot for Healthier Food
